column4: seems like a multiple sound conflicted issue there. can you at least reach to The GRUB Menu !
I can reach the install-to-hdd/memcheck/livecd menu, if that was what you meant
Yes .. press "e" there and type this  .. acpi=off .. after quiet splash .. as a boot option then press Ctrl+X to boot , when you reach the Desktop make sure you sudo update and upgrade the system.
nothing happens when I press "e"
no menu shows up!
correct, still the installer boot menu
so you are in the LiveCD now , Right !
yes, in the installer boot menu. Options: run ubuntu from this USB / Install ubuntu on a hard disk / test memory / boot from first hdd / advanced options / help
is there FKeys as an options , or what does Advaced options show!
found it, had to press <tab>. Now it shows a completely grey screen. No desktop.
am a bit lost there .. Back tot he GRUB Menu .. what do you see if you press Advanced options and / help
advanced options only shows "back...". Help shows some f-keys, then after a few seconds it shows a lot of text, and goes into the ubuntu 11.10 splashscreen
yes help ,  is there F6 Key as an option !
after the splash screen it shows a lot of text again, and then gives me a cmd line. It tells me "to run a command as administrator, use sudo command", see "man sudo_root" for details
should I go check that out first, or stay in this cmd line?
http://i.imgur.com/5ycqT.jpg is where I am now. (sorry for the flash, I can retake it without flash if necessary)
thats okay , thanks ..  what happens if you run startx ..

it outputs a lot of text, it hangs at "ddxSigGiveUp: Closing log" for a few seconds, then: xinit: giving up, xinit: unable to connect to X server: Connection refused, xinit: server error. Then it gives me back the cmd line
okay , thats graphic card driver issue .. go back to the GRUB Menu o try some boot option .. but while you on that screen check what graphic card you have " sudo lshw -C Video "  Nvidia , or  ..
it says: PCI (sysfs)
Yeah , waite for a sec ..
intel corp 33MHz vga_comp_controller

for your knowledge, I have before tried to install the graphics card on this device when I was running 11.04. It made the system not boot anymore. I couldn't get the right resolution before I attempted that though.
Intel GMA 500 integrated graphics card
okay , thats an onboard one ..
yes. It's a netbook. I think it only has an onboard one.
Yeah , so now i got the boot option that might pass you to the Desktop .. all you you need now is to paste that option to boot.
should I reboot and go back to the option menu?
Press Ctrl+Alt+BAckspace to reboot .. when you see the GRUB Menu press "e"
Yes.
ctrl alt backspace does not make it reboot.
I'll just use the power button to reboot
pressing "e" does not do anything.
I can "Press ENTER to boot or TAB to edit a menu entry"
Okay , Tab then ..
do you see the kernel Menu !
you see quiet splash in a line there ..
should I <tab> on run ubuntu from this USB, or on Install Ubuntu on a HDD?
Tab to edit the boot option ..
ok, do you need to know what it says?
is there a " quiet splash " under a line there ..
/casper/vmlinuz noprompt cdrom-detect/try-usb=true file=/cdrom/preseed/ubuntu.seed boot=casper presistent initrd=/casper/initrd.lz splash --
okay , replace -- with i915.modeset=1 .. then press ESc should take you back to the first menu try Run Ubuntu from USB
this takes me to the same screen I showed you a picture of. I'm at ubuntu@ubuntu:~$
okay , try i915.modeset=0
same screen again
I think I can just press enter to boot into the edited option
Alright , Enter it is .. now try adding this option as well .. acpi=off
same thing with acpi=off and i915.modeset=0
and if you replaced acpi=force with =off ..
you mean replace acpi=off with =force?
also try =1 on that modeset .
im trying =1 and =off now, that gives me a light grey screen
Yes , acpi=force ..
nice step ..
in combination with modeset?
Yes .. i915.modeset=1
that gives me the same as in the picture.
should I go and try 10.04?
what if you remove splash ..
Yeah try
thus gives me many errors, a lot of "stdin: error 0"
and...the same screen again. I'll go try 10.04.
press Alt+F5 .. see if that pass you throu ..
Alright. g'luck
thanks a lot.

You're welcome , hope you get it working .. it just so happend that i've faced the same issue bu with a different card so i used a diff boot option and it passed me throu ..then i had to active the card driver.
I've been having issues with the graphic card on ubuntu before, sadly. I really appreciate your help.
so keep trying with those options.
have you tried with the install option .. did it pass to the desktop!
it did not
okay , i feel ya .. lemme know how it goes.
but it looks like you have instaled Ubuntu on the HDD .. Right!
I had, but it didn't work after it crashed during update to 11.10
okay , so you have a broken 11.10 on the HDD .
correct
on the SSD to be precise
:-) , so have you tried to sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade from there!  might help
it can't boot
broken drivers, it says
Oh!
it gives me the option to continue regardless, but the system does not respond to anything
10.04 boots.
Yeah i bet ..
you got to that login screen after which menu ! is that the broken 11.10 .
I don't understand what you just asked
the tty login screen with no X with your Ubuntu user-name ..
I did not get to a login screen when I just booted 10.04 from the USB, it takes me straight to the desktop
Oh okay , so that tty screen with no X was the broken 11.10 .
I think so
is that system monted and shown in your 10.04 .
yes.
Not anymore though, I am currently already installing 10.04
Alright cool .
